subject: Politics
title: Radicalism vs Extremism
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Radicalism vs Extremism.

hook.text: Martin Luther King was called a radical. So was Osama bin Laden. The word covers heroes and monsters.

buildup.text: Radicals want fundamental system change. Extremists are willing to use violence to achieve it.

discovery.text: Abolitionists were radicals â€” they wanted to end slavery entirely. They worked within legal systems.

twist.text: The line between radical and extremist is political. Governments label opponents 'extremist' to discredit them.

climax.text: Today's radical idea is often tomorrow's mainstream policy. Universal suffrage was once considered extreme.

punchline.text: Radical means wanting deep change. Extreme means how far you'll go.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between radicalism and extremism?
options: Radicals want system change; extremists use violence to achieve it
They are exactly the same thing
Radicals are always right-wing; extremists are left-wing
